intro: Lasianthaea ceanothifolia var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender-flowered lasianthaea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its botanical features make it an attractive and relatively low-maintenance plant for xeriscaping and native gardens.
